entry.title: 713. Subarray Product Less Than k
entry.summary:
url: https://leetcode.com/problems/subarray-product-less-than-k/description/
Input: nums = [10, 5, 2, 6], k = 100 Output: 8 Explanation: [10] [5] [2] [6] [10, 5] = 50 [5, 2] = 10 [2, 6] = 12 [5, 2, 6] = 60 Note that [10, 5, 2] is not included as the product of 100 is not strictly less than k.
💻 Code 1. Solution Sliding Window
TC: $O(n)$ SC: $O(1)$

entry.title: 56. Merge Intervals
entry.summary:
url: https://leetcode.com/problems/merge-intervals/description/
Input: intervals = [[1,3],[2,6],[8,10],[15,18]] Output: [[1,6],[8,10],[15,18]] Explanation: Since intervals [1,3] and [2,6] overlap, merge them into [1,6].
💻 Code
Approach :
There are two cases to be considered:

entry.title: 230. Kth Smallest Element in a BST

link.title: 230. Kth Smallest Element in a BST

entry.summary:
url: https://leetcode.com/problems/kth-smallest-element-in-a-bst/description/
Input: root = [5,3,6,2,4,null,null,1], k = 3 Output: 3
💻 Code
Approach :
In the binary tree, inorder counts elements as increasing sequence.
1. Iteration Inorder
TC: $O(h + k)$
$h$: height
SC: $O(n)$

entry.title: 2302. Count Subarrays With Score Less Than K

link.title: 2302. Count Subarrays With Score Less Than K

entry.summary:
url: https://leetcode.com/problems/count-subarrays-with-score-less-than-k/description/
Input: nums = [2,1,4,3,5], k = 10 Output: 6 Explanation: The 6 subarrays having scores less than 10 are:
[2] with score 2 * 1 = 2. [1] with score 1 * 1 = 1. [4] with score 4 * 1 = 4. [3] with score 3 * 1 = 3. [5] with score 5 * 1 = 5. [2,1] with score (2 + 1) * 2 = 6. 💡 No...
